meanings.definition: To make a soft murmuring sound, as a dove or pigeon.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird coos softly in its nest.
meanings.sent2: She loves to hear the doves coo in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to coo like a bird to make her baby brother laugh.
meanings.sent4: As the wind passed through the trees, it seemed to coo a lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The gentle cooing of the doves filled the peaceful morning air.

meanings.definition: The soft murmuring sound made by a dove or pigeon.
meanings.sent1: The coo of the dove was a soothing melody in the park.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the gentle coo of pigeons on the rooftop.
meanings.sent3: The coo of the doves outside her window woke her up with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The coo of the pigeons echoed through the city streets like a calming chant.
meanings.sent5: The familiar coo of the doves brought back memories of lazy summer afternoons.
